<small>Hebrew form: [[H4310]]</small>
 <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מַן‎</span> (so [[BDB#Gi|Gi]], with most [[BDB#MSS|MSS]]., supported by Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">; see [[BDB#Kau|K]]<sup>§ 22, 1</sup>), <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מָן‎</span> ([[BDB#Baer|Baer]]: see on [[Dan.3.6|Dan 3:6]]), **interrogative pronoun** ==who?== (Old Aramaic, Nabataean, Palmyrene <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מן‎</span> [[BDB#Ldzb|Lzb]]<sup>312</sup> [[BDB#Cooke|Cooke]]<sup>188</sup>), [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מן‎</span>, Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, Ethiopic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> [[BDB#W|W]]<sup>CG 123:</sup> Biblical Hebrew  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִי‎</span>); — 

**1.** ***who***? [[Ezra.5.3|Ezra 5:3]]; [[Ezra.5.9|Ezra 5:9]] strengthened by <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎הוּא‎</span>, [[Dan.3.15|Dan 3:15]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎וּמַןהֿוּא אֱלָהּ דִּי‎</span> ***who is*** the God who . . . ? (compare Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> contracted from <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, and <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מַנּוּ‎</span> in the Syriacizing [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] to Proverbs: also Biblical Hebrew <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מִי הוּא‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎הוּא‎</span> **4 b** <span class="bdbLangGreek">β</span>); so in the plural [[Ezra.5.4|Ezra 5:4]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מִןאִֿנוּן שְׁמָהָת‎</span> ***what*** (literally ***who:*** compare <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מִי‎</span> **1 a**, and [[Gen.32.28|Gen 32:28]]; [[Exod.3.13|Exod 3:13]] [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]]) are the names of . . .? 

**2.** <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מַןדּֿי‎</span> ***whosoever*** (literally ***who is there that . . .***? see Biblical Hebrew  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִי‎</span> **g**) [[Dan.3.6|Dan 3:6]]; [[Dan.3.11|Dan 3:11]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מִןדִּֿי לָא יִפֵּל‎</span>, [[Dan.4.14|Dan 4:14]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎וּלְמִן דִּי יִצְבֵּא יִתְּנִנַּהּ‎</span> to ***whomsoever*** he willeth, he giveth it, v.[[Dan.4.22|Dan 4:22]] v.[[Dan.4.29|Dan 4:29]]; [[Dan.5.21|Dan 5:21]] (so Nabataean <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מן די‎</span>, [[BDB#Cooke|Cooke]]<sup>241, 325 ff.</sup>; [[BDB#Tg|ᵑ7]] <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎מַן דְּ‎</span>; Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">; compare Egyptian Aramaic [[BDB#S-C|S-C]]<sup>Pap. K 7, 12</sup> <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎ולמן זי צבית תנתן‎</span>).
